item.title: Full litter bin, 11th November
item.description:

item.title: Month 3 of rubbish that has not been cleared, 11th November
item.description:
This has been left outside 49 Rutherglen Road since September. My emails to the Empty Homes and Environmental Health teams have been ignored and this is not only creating an eyesore but is a health hazard and attracting people to rummage through the items.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rutherglen Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights, 11th November
item.description:
Traffic lights all round junction to A13 are faulty. 7 seconds to get thru system causing congestion.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mardyke Junction, South Ockendon

item.title: White trailer and van been parked at side of church end of dumbreck road and westmount road for some weeks possibly 4 weeks. concerned it may be stolen and dumped because it has expensive looking plants and small shed in the trailer. seems odd to leave this for thislength of time unattended. it is taxed and has mot in date, 11th November
item.description:
As this trailer contains possibly valuable plants and shed, it may have been stolen. The van has been covered in graffitti.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Westmount Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over large dirt hole at base of tree, 11th November
item.description:
Outside 72 Southwood Road. The base of the tree has an over large dirt patch which is covered in weeds and is used as a dog toilet. A broken paving slab was removed some time ago and has never replaced and as you can see from the photo it is now a complete mess, health hazard when getting out of the back of the car due to being used as a dog toilet. Can it be cleared of weeds and the dirt part reduced in size back to how it was. I can only assume the repair was not listed when the broken paving slab was removed. Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southwood Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 22 Church Row, NW36UP, 11th November
item.description:
A tree in the island on the Church Row has been broken and requires replacement. The drive from Sortera involve has given his details and will be in contact with the council tomorrow to work through how to rectify this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Church Row, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned sweeper’s bag, Victoria Way, 11th November
item.description:
Flytipping is lazy and criminal, so can this bag of rubbish that’s been here since at least Friday in a known flytipping hotspot be dealt with before it attracts more dumping?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Victoria Way, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Untaxed, No MOT, Not Road Worthy, 11th November
item.description:
Vehicle has been on the side of the road across from Thomas A Becket primary school for the past few months; its now up on blocks, no rear wheels, no headlights, and the door to the rear is broken. We've got enough problems with people breaking into cars down here already and don't more abandoned vehicles to attract more vehicle broken into.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mottisfont Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Voi e-bikes are all over the sidewalk, currently 4 of them, 11th November
item.description:
There should be no e-bikes parked outside of the designated area. Since Hackney council made a deal with Voi, things have become much worse, in many places there is a huge overflow of both green and Voi e-bikes - on the pavements and roads

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Crescent, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
